result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 6/23/2018.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.   STAYED to 6/24/2015 by noon.
 Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work, work crew, school, elder care, AODA treatment.  Defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J Wilson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, work crew, school, elder care, AODA treatment. Court makes the defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center. STAYED to 6/24/2015 by noon.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/23/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/23/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Robert J Wilson in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant in COurt due to Justicew Point Violation. Court admonished the defendant regarding future positive tests.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Robert J Wilson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant Robert J Wilson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt. David Behm for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant suffered a loss in the family. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 4/30/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Robert J Wilson not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. / SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 3/3/2015 st 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Original Transcript (11 pages) commencing 01/12/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Robert J Wilson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Robert J Wilson in custody.  Ronald Dague for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Robert J Wilson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Robert J Wilson in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
